1use futures::StreamExt;
2use std::fmt;
3use std::sync::Arc;
4use std::time::Duration;
5use tokio::time::Instant;
6
7use arc_swap::ArcSwap;
8use relay_base_schema::project::ProjectKey;
9use relay_config::Config;
10use relay_quotas::CachedRateLimits;
11use relay_sampling::evaluation::ReservoirCounters;
12use relay_statsd::metric;
13
14use crate::services::projects::project::{ProjectState, Revision};
15use crate::services::projects::source::SourceProjectState;
16use crate::statsd::{RelayHistograms, RelayTimers};
17use crate::utils::{RetryBackoff, UniqueScheduledQueue};
18
19/// The backing storage for a project cache.
20///
21/// Exposes the only interface to delete from [`Shared`], guaranteed by
22/// requiring exclusive/mutable access to [`ProjectStore`].
23///
24/// [`Shared`] can be extended through [`Shared::get_or_create`], in which case
25/// the private state is missing. Users of [`Shared::get_or_create`] *must* trigger
26/// a fetch to create the private state and keep it updated.
27/// This guarantees that eventually the project state is populated, but for a undetermined,
28/// time it is possible that shared state exists without the respective private state.
29#[derive(Default)]
30pub struct ProjectStore {
31    /// The shared state, which can be accessed concurrently.
32    shared: Arc<Shared>,
33    /// The private, mutably exclusive state, used to maintain the project state.
34    private: hashbrown::HashMap<ProjectKey, PrivateProjectState>,
35    /// Scheduled queue tracking all evictions.
36    evictions: UniqueScheduledQueue<ProjectKey>,
37}
38
39impl ProjectStore {
40    /// Retrieves a [`Shared`] handle which can be freely shared with multiple consumers.
41    pub fn shared(&self) -> Arc<Shared> {
42        Arc::clone(&self.shared)
43    }
44
45    /// Tries to begin a new fetch for the passed `project_key`.
46    ///
47    /// Returns `None` if no fetch is necessary or there is already a fetch ongoing.
48    /// A returned [`Fetch`] must be scheduled and completed with [`Fetch::complete`] and
49    /// [`Self::complete_fetch`].
50    pub fn try_begin_fetch(&mut self, project_key: ProjectKey, config: &Config) -> Option<Fetch> {
51        let fetch = self
52            .get_or_create(project_key, config)
53            .try_begin_fetch(config);
54
55        // If there is a new fetch, remove the pending eviction, it will be re-scheduled once the
56        // fetch is completed.
57        if fetch.is_some() {
58            self.evictions.remove(&project_key);
59        }
60
61        fetch
62    }
63
64    /// Completes a [`CompletedFetch`] started with [`Self::try_begin_fetch`].
65    ///
66    /// Returns a new [`Fetch`] if another fetch must be scheduled. This happens when the fetched
67    /// [`ProjectState`] is still pending or already deemed expired.
68    #[must_use = "an incomplete fetch must be retried"]
69    pub fn complete_fetch(&mut self, fetch: CompletedFetch, config: &Config) -> Option<Fetch> {
70        let project_key = fetch.project_key();
71
72        // Eviction is not possible for projects which are currently being fetched.
73        // Hence if there was a started fetch, the project state must always exist at this stage.
74        debug_assert!(self.shared.projects.pin().get(&project_key).is_some());
75        debug_assert!(self.private.get(&project_key).is_some());
76
77        let mut project = self.get_or_create(project_key, config);
78        let expiry = project.complete_fetch(fetch, config);
79        // Schedule another fetch if necessary, usually should only happen if
80        // the completed fetch is pending.
81        let new_fetch = project.try_begin_fetch(config);
82
83        if let Some(ExpiryTime(when)) = expiry {
84            debug_assert!(
85                new_fetch.is_none(),
86                "there cannot be a new fetch and a scheduled expiry"
87            );
88
89            self.evictions.schedule(when, project_key);
90        }
91
92        metric!(
93            histogram(RelayHistograms::ProjectStateCacheSize) = self.shared.projects.len() as u64,
94            storage = "shared"
95        );
96        metric!(
97            histogram(RelayHistograms::ProjectStateCacheSize) = self.private.len() as u64,
98            storage = "private"
99        );
100
101        new_fetch
102    }
103
104    /// Waits for the next scheduled eviction and returns an [`Eviction`] token.
105    ///
106    /// The returned [`Eviction`] token must be immediately turned in using [`Self::evict`].
107    ///
108    /// The returned future is cancellation safe.
109    pub async fn next_eviction(&mut self) -> Option<Eviction> {
110        if self.evictions.is_empty() {
111            return None;
112        }
113        self.evictions.next().await.map(Eviction)
114    }
115
116    /// Evicts a project using an [`Eviction`] token returned from [`Self::next_eviction`].
117    pub fn evict(&mut self, Eviction(project_key): Eviction) {
118        // Remove the private part.
119        let Some(private) = self.private.remove(&project_key) else {
120            // Not possible if all invariants are upheld.
121            debug_assert!(false, "no private state for eviction");
122            return;
123        };
124
125        debug_assert!(
126            matches!(private.state, FetchState::Complete { .. }),
127            "private state must be completed"
128        );
129
130        // Remove the shared part.
131        let shared = self.shared.projects.pin();
132        let _removed = shared.remove(&project_key);
133        debug_assert!(
134            _removed.is_some(),
135            "an expired project must exist in the shared state"
136        );
137    }
138
139    /// Get a reference to the current project or create a new project.
140    ///
141    /// For internal use only, a created project must always be fetched immediately.
142    fn get_or_create(&mut self, project_key: ProjectKey, config: &Config) -> ProjectRef<'_> {
143        #[cfg(debug_assertions)]
144        if self.private.contains_key(&project_key) {
145            // We have exclusive access to the private part, there are no concurrent deletions
146            // hence if we have a private state there must always be a shared state as well.
147            //
148            // The opposite is not true, the shared state may have been created concurrently
149            // through the shared access.
150            debug_assert!(self.shared.projects.pin().contains_key(&project_key));
151        }
152
153        let private = self
154            .private
155            .entry(project_key)
156            .or_insert_with(|| PrivateProjectState::new(project_key, config));
157
158        let shared = self
159            .shared
160            .projects
161            .pin()
162            .get_or_insert_with(project_key, Default::default)
163            .clone();
164
165        ProjectRef { private, shared }
166    }
167}
168
169/// The shared and concurrently accessible handle to the project cache.
170#[derive(Default)]
171pub struct Shared {
172    projects: papaya::HashMap<ProjectKey, SharedProjectState, ahash::RandomState>,
173}
174
175impl Shared {
176    /// Returns the existing project state or creates a new one.
177    ///
178    /// The caller must ensure that the project cache is instructed to
179    /// [`super::ProjectCache::Fetch`] the retrieved project.
180    pub fn get_or_create(&self, project_key: ProjectKey) -> SharedProject {
181        // The fast path, we expect the project to exist.
182        let projects = self.projects.pin();
183        if let Some(project) = projects.get(&project_key) {
184            return project.to_shared_project();
185        }
186
187        // The slow path, try to attempt to insert, somebody else may have been faster, but that's okay.
188        match projects.try_insert(project_key, Default::default()) {
189            Ok(inserted) => inserted.to_shared_project(),
190            Err(occupied) => occupied.current.to_shared_project(),
191        }
192    }
193}
194
195/// TEST ONLY bypass to make the project cache mockable.
196#[cfg(test)]
197impl Shared {
198    /// Updates the project state for a project.
199    ///
200    /// TEST ONLY!
201    pub fn test_set_project_state(&self, project_key: ProjectKey, state: ProjectState) {
202        self.projects
203            .pin()
204            .get_or_insert_with(project_key, Default::default)
205            .set_project_state(state);
206    }
207
208    /// Returns `true` if there exists a shared state for the passed `project_key`.
209    pub fn test_has_project_created(&self, project_key: ProjectKey) -> bool {
210        self.projects.pin().contains_key(&project_key)
211    }
212}
213
214impl fmt::Debug for Shared {
215    fn fmt(&self, f: &mut fmt::Formatter<'_>) -> fmt::Result {
216        f.debug_struct("Shared")
217            .field("num_projects", &self.projects.len())
218            .finish()
219    }
220}
221
222/// A single project from the [`Shared`] project cache.
223pub struct SharedProject(Arc<SharedProjectStateInner>);
224
225impl SharedProject {
226    /// Returns a reference to the contained [`ProjectState`].
227    pub fn project_state(&self) -> &ProjectState {
228        &self.0.state
229    }
230
231    /// Returns a reference to the contained [`CachedRateLimits`].
232    pub fn cached_rate_limits(&self) -> &CachedRateLimits {
233        // Exposing cached rate limits may be a bad idea, this allows mutation
234        // and caching of rate limits for pending projects, which may or may not be fine.
235        // Although, for now this is fine.
236        //
237        // Read only access is easily achievable if we return only the current rate limits.
238        &self.0.rate_limits
239    }
240
241    /// Returns a reference to the contained [`ReservoirCounters`].
242    pub fn reservoir_counters(&self) -> &ReservoirCounters {
243        &self.0.reservoir_counters
244    }
245}
246
247/// TEST ONLY bypass to make the project cache mockable.
248#[cfg(test)]
249impl SharedProject {
250    /// Creates a new [`SharedProject`] for testing only.
251    pub fn for_test(state: ProjectState) -> Self {
252        Self(Arc::new(SharedProjectStateInner {
253            state,
254            ..Default::default()
255        }))
256    }
257}
258
259/// Reference to a full project wrapping shared and private state.
260struct ProjectRef<'a> {
261    shared: SharedProjectState,
262    private: &'a mut PrivateProjectState,
263}
264
265impl ProjectRef<'_> {
266    fn try_begin_fetch(&mut self, config: &Config) -> Option<Fetch> {
267        let now = Instant::now();
268        self.private
269            .try_begin_fetch(now, config)
270            .map(|fetch| fetch.with_revision(self.shared.revision()))
271    }
272
273    fn complete_fetch(&mut self, fetch: CompletedFetch, config: &Config) -> Option<ExpiryTime> {
274        let now = Instant::now();
275
276        if let Some(latency) = fetch.latency() {
277            let delay = match fetch.delay() {
278                Some(delay) if delay.as_secs() <= 15 => "lte15s",
279                Some(delay) if delay.as_secs() <= 30 => "lte30s",
280                Some(delay) if delay.as_secs() <= 60 => "lte60s",
281                Some(delay) if delay.as_secs() <= 120 => "lte120",
282                Some(delay) if delay.as_secs() <= 300 => "lte300s",
283                Some(delay) if delay.as_secs() <= 600 => "lte600s",
284                Some(delay) if delay.as_secs() <= 1800 => "lte1800s",
285                Some(delay) if delay.as_secs() <= 3600 => "lte3600s",
286                Some(_) => "gt3600s",
287                None => "none",
288            };
289            metric!(
290                timer(RelayTimers::ProjectCacheUpdateLatency) = latency,
291                delay = delay
292            );
293        }
294
295        if !fetch.is_pending() {
296            let state = match fetch.state {
297                SourceProjectState::New(_) => "new",
298                SourceProjectState::NotModified => "not_modified",
299            };
300
301            metric!(
302                timer(RelayTimers::ProjectCacheFetchDuration) = fetch.duration(now),
303                state = state
304            );
305        }
306
307        // Update private and shared state with the new data.
308        let expiry = self.private.complete_fetch(&fetch, now, config);
309        match fetch.state {
310            // Keep the old state around if the current fetch is pending.
311            // It may still be useful to callers.
312            SourceProjectState::New(state) if !state.is_pending() => {
313                self.shared.set_project_state(state);
314            }
315            _ => {}
316        }
317
318        expiry
319    }
320}
321
322/// A [`Eviction`] token.
323///
324/// The token must be turned in using [`ProjectStore::evict`].
325#[must_use = "an eviction must be used"]
326pub struct Eviction(ProjectKey);
327
328impl Eviction {
329    /// Returns the [`ProjectKey`] of the project that needs to be evicted.
330    pub fn project_key(&self) -> ProjectKey {
331        self.0
332    }
333}
334
335/// A [`Fetch`] token.
336///
337/// When returned it must be executed and completed using [`Self::complete`].
338#[must_use = "a fetch must be executed"]
339#[derive(Debug)]
340pub struct Fetch {
341    project_key: ProjectKey,
342    previous_fetch: Option<Instant>,
343    initiated: Instant,
344    when: Option<Instant>,
345    revision: Revision,
346}
347
348impl Fetch {
349    /// Returns the [`ProjectKey`] of the project to fetch.
350    pub fn project_key(&self) -> ProjectKey {
351        self.project_key
352    }
353
354    /// Returns when the fetch for the project should be scheduled.
355    ///
356    /// This can be now (as soon as possible, indicated by `None`) or a later point in time,
357    /// if the project is currently in a backoff.
358    pub fn when(&self) -> Option<Instant> {
359        self.when
360    }
361
362    /// Returns the revisions of the currently cached project.
363    ///
364    /// If the upstream indicates it does not have a different version of this project
365    /// we do not need to update the local state.
366    pub fn revision(&self) -> Revision {
367        self.revision.clone()
368    }
369
370    /// Completes the fetch with a result and returns a [`CompletedFetch`].
371    pub fn complete(self, state: SourceProjectState) -> CompletedFetch {
372        CompletedFetch { fetch: self, state }
373    }
374
375    fn with_revision(mut self, revision: Revision) -> Self {
376        self.revision = revision;
377        self
378    }
379}
380
381/// The result of an executed [`Fetch`].
382#[must_use = "a completed fetch must be acted upon"]
383#[derive(Debug)]
384pub struct CompletedFetch {
385    fetch: Fetch,
386    state: SourceProjectState,
387}
388
389impl CompletedFetch {
390    /// Returns the [`ProjectKey`] of the project which was fetched.
391    pub fn project_key(&self) -> ProjectKey {
392        self.fetch.project_key()
393    }
394
395    /// Returns the amount of time passed between the last successful fetch for this project and the start of this fetch.
396    ///
397    /// `None` if this is the first fetch.
398    fn delay(&self) -> Option<Duration> {
399        self.fetch
400            .previous_fetch
401            .map(|pf| self.fetch.initiated.duration_since(pf))
402    }
403
404    /// Returns the duration between first initiating the fetch and `now`.
405    fn duration(&self, now: Instant) -> Duration {
406        now.duration_since(self.fetch.initiated)
407    }
408
409    /// Returns the update latency of the fetched project config from the upstream.
410    ///
411    /// Is `None`, when no project config could be fetched, or if this was the first
412    /// fetch of a project config.
413    ///
414    /// Note: this latency is computed on access, it does not use the time when the [`Fetch`]
415    /// was marked as (completed)[`Fetch::complete`].
416    fn latency(&self) -> Option<Duration> {
417        // We're not interested in initial fetches. The latency on the first fetch
418        // has no meaning about how long it takes for an updated project config to be
419        // propagated to a Relay.
420        let is_first_fetch = self.fetch.revision().as_str().is_none();
421        if is_first_fetch {
422            return None;
423        }
424
425        let project_info = match &self.state {
426            SourceProjectState::New(ProjectState::Enabled(project_info)) => project_info,
427            // Not modified or deleted/disabled -> no latency to track.
428            //
429            // Currently we discard the last changed timestamp for disabled projects,
430            // it would be possible to do so and then also expose a latency for disabled projects.
431            _ => return None,
432        };
433
434        // A matching revision is not an update.
435        if project_info.rev == self.fetch.revision {
436            return None;
437        }
438
439        let elapsed = chrono::Utc::now() - project_info.last_change?;
440        elapsed.to_std().ok()
441    }
442
443    /// Returns `true` if the fetch completed with a pending status.
444    fn is_pending(&self) -> bool {
445        match &self.state {
446            SourceProjectState::New(state) => state.is_pending(),
447            SourceProjectState::NotModified => false,
448        }
449    }
450}
451
452/// The state of a project contained in the [`Shared`] project cache.
453///
454/// This state is interior mutable and allows updates to the project.
455#[derive(Debug, Default, Clone)]
456struct SharedProjectState(Arc<ArcSwap<SharedProjectStateInner>>);
457
458impl SharedProjectState {
459    /// Updates the project state.
460    fn set_project_state(&self, state: ProjectState) {
461        let prev = self.0.rcu(|stored| SharedProjectStateInner {
462            state: state.clone(),
463            rate_limits: Arc::clone(&stored.rate_limits),
464            reservoir_counters: Arc::clone(&stored.reservoir_counters),
465        });
466
467        // Try clean expired reservoir counters.
468        //
469        // We do it after the `rcu`, to not re-run this more often than necessary.
470        if let Some(state) = state.enabled() {
471            let config = state.config.sampling.as_ref();
472            if let Some(config) = config.and_then(|eb| eb.as_ref().ok()) {
473                // We can safely use previous here, the `rcu` just replaced the state, the
474                // reservoir counters did not change.
475                //
476                // `try_lock` to not potentially block, it's a best effort cleanup.
477                if let Ok(mut counters) = prev.reservoir_counters.try_lock() {
478                    counters.retain(|key, _| config.rules.iter().any(|rule| rule.id == *key));
479                }
480            }
481        }
482    }
483
484    /// Extracts and clones the revision from the contained project state.
485    fn revision(&self) -> Revision {
486        self.0.as_ref().load().state.revision().clone()
487    }
488
489    /// Transforms this interior mutable handle to an immutable [`SharedProject`].
490    fn to_shared_project(&self) -> SharedProject {
491        SharedProject(self.0.as_ref().load_full())
492    }
493}
494
495/// The data contained in a [`SharedProjectState`].
496///
497/// All fields must be cheap to clone and are ideally just a single `Arc`.
498/// Partial updates to [`SharedProjectState`], are performed using `rcu` cloning all fields.
499#[derive(Debug, Default)]
500struct SharedProjectStateInner {
501    state: ProjectState,
502    rate_limits: Arc<CachedRateLimits>,
503    reservoir_counters: ReservoirCounters,
504}
505
506/// Current fetch state for a project.
507///
508/// ─────► Pending ◄─────┐
509///           │          │
510///           │          │Backoff
511///           ▼          │
512/// ┌───► InProgress ────┘
513/// │         │
514/// │         │
515/// │         ▼
516/// └───── Complete
517#[derive(Debug)]
518enum FetchState {
519    /// There is a fetch currently in progress.
520    InProgress,
521    /// A successful fetch is pending.
522    ///
523    /// Projects which have not yet been fetched are in the pending state,
524    /// as well as projects which have a fetch in progress but were notified
525    /// from upstream that the project config is still pending.
526    ///
527    /// If the upstream notifies this instance about a pending config,
528    /// a backoff is applied, before trying again.
529    Pending {
530        /// Instant when the fetch was first initiated.
531        ///
532        /// A state may be transitioned multiple times from [`Self::Pending`] to [`Self::InProgress`]
533        /// and back to [`Self::Pending`]. This timestamp is the first time when the state
534        /// was transitioned from [`Self::Complete`] to [`Self::InProgress`].
535        ///
536        /// Only `None` on first fetch.
537        initiated: Option<Instant>,
538        /// Time when the next fetch should be attempted.
539        ///
540        /// `None` means soon as possible.
541        next_fetch_attempt: Option<Instant>,
542    },
543    /// There was a successful non-pending fetch.
544    Complete {
545        /// Time when the fetch was completed.
546        when: LastFetch,
547    },
548}
549
550/// Contains all mutable state necessary to maintain the project cache.
551struct PrivateProjectState {
552    /// Project key this state belongs to.
553    project_key: ProjectKey,
554
555    /// The current fetch state.
556    state: FetchState,
557    /// The current backoff used for calculating the next fetch attempt.
558    ///
559    /// The backoff is reset after a successful, non-pending fetch.
560    backoff: RetryBackoff,
561
562    /// The last time the state was successfully fetched.
563    ///
564    /// May be `None` when the state has never been successfully fetched.
565    ///
566    /// This is purely informational, all necessary information to make
567    /// state transitions is contained in [`FetchState`].
568    last_fetch: Option<Instant>,
569}
570
571impl PrivateProjectState {
572    fn new(project_key: ProjectKey, config: &Config) -> Self {
573        Self {
574            project_key,
575            state: FetchState::Pending {
576                initiated: None,
577                next_fetch_attempt: None,
578            },
579            backoff: RetryBackoff::new(config.http_max_retry_interval()),
580            last_fetch: None,
581        }
582    }
583
584    fn try_begin_fetch(&mut self, now: Instant, config: &Config) -> Option<Fetch> {
585        let (initiated, when) = match &self.state {
586            FetchState::InProgress => {
587                relay_log::trace!(
588                    tags.project_key = self.project_key.as_str(),
589                    "project fetch skipped, fetch in progress"
590                );
591                return None;
592            }
593            FetchState::Pending {
594                initiated,
595                next_fetch_attempt,
596            } => {
597                // Schedule a new fetch, even if there is a backoff, it will just be sleeping for a while.
598                (initiated.unwrap_or(now), *next_fetch_attempt)
599            }
600            FetchState::Complete { when } => {
601                // Sanity check to make sure timestamps do not drift.
602                debug_assert_eq!(Some(when.0), self.last_fetch);
603
604                if when.check_expiry(now, config).is_fresh() {
605                    // The current state is up to date, no need to start another fetch.
606                    relay_log::trace!(
607                        tags.project_key = self.project_key.as_str(),
608                        "project fetch skipped, already up to date"
609                    );
610                    return None;
611                }
612
613                (now, None)
614            }
615        };
616
617        // Mark a current fetch in progress.
618        self.state = FetchState::InProgress;
619
620        relay_log::trace!(
621            tags.project_key = &self.project_key.as_str(),
622            attempts = self.backoff.attempt() + 1,
623            "project state fetch scheduled in {:?}",
624            when.unwrap_or(now).saturating_duration_since(now),
625        );
626
627        Some(Fetch {
628            project_key: self.project_key,
629            previous_fetch: self.last_fetch,
630            initiated,
631            when,
632            revision: Revision::default(),
633        })
634    }
635
636    fn complete_fetch(
637        &mut self,
638        fetch: &CompletedFetch,
639        now: Instant,
640        config: &Config,
641    ) -> Option<ExpiryTime> {
642        debug_assert!(
643            matches!(self.state, FetchState::InProgress),
644            "fetch completed while there was no current fetch registered"
645        );
646
647        if fetch.is_pending() {
648            let next_backoff = self.backoff.next_backoff();
649            let next_fetch_attempt = match next_backoff.is_zero() {
650                false => now.checked_add(next_backoff),
651                true => None,
652            };
653            self.state = FetchState::Pending {
654                next_fetch_attempt,
655                initiated: Some(fetch.fetch.initiated),
656            };
657            relay_log::trace!(
658                tags.project_key = &self.project_key.as_str(),
659                "project state fetch completed but still pending"
660            );
661
662            None
663        } else {
664            relay_log::trace!(
665                tags.project_key = &self.project_key.as_str(),
666                "project state fetch completed with non-pending config"
667            );
668
669            self.backoff.reset();
670            self.last_fetch = Some(now);
671
672            let when = LastFetch(now);
673            self.state = FetchState::Complete { when };
674            Some(when.expiry_time(config))
675        }
676    }
677}
678
679/// New type containing the last successful fetch time as an [`Instant`].
680#[derive(Debug, Copy, Clone)]
681struct LastFetch(Instant);
682
683impl LastFetch {
684    /// Returns the [`Expiry`] of the last fetch in relation to `now`.
685    fn check_expiry(&self, now: Instant, config: &Config) -> Expiry {
686        let expiry = config.project_cache_expiry();
687        let elapsed = now.saturating_duration_since(self.0);
688
689        if elapsed >= expiry + config.project_grace_period() {
690            Expiry::Expired
691        } else if elapsed >= expiry {
692            Expiry::Stale
693        } else {
694            Expiry::Fresh
695        }
696    }
697
698    /// Returns when the project is based to expire based on the current [`LastFetch`].
699    fn expiry_time(&self, config: &Config) -> ExpiryTime {
700        ExpiryTime(self.0 + config.project_grace_period() + config.project_cache_expiry())
701    }
702}
703
704/// Expiry state of a project.
705#[derive(Clone, Copy, Debug, Eq, PartialEq, Hash)]
706enum Expiry {
707    /// The project state is perfectly up to date.
708    Fresh,
709    /// The project state is outdated but events depending on this project state can still be
710    /// processed. The state should be refreshed in the background though.
711    Stale,
712    /// The project state is completely outdated and events need to be buffered up until the new
713    /// state has been fetched.
714    Expired,
715}
716
717impl Expiry {
718    /// Returns `true` if the project is up-to-date and does not need to be fetched.
719    fn is_fresh(&self) -> bool {
720        matches!(self, Self::Fresh)
721    }
722}
723
724/// Instant when a project is scheduled for expiry.
725#[must_use = "an expiry time must be used to schedule an eviction"]
726struct ExpiryTime(Instant);
727
728#[cfg(test)]
729mod tests {
730    use std::time::Duration;
731
732    use super::*;
733
734    async fn collect_evicted(store: &mut ProjectStore) -> Vec<ProjectKey> {
735        let mut evicted = Vec::new();
736        // Small timeout to really only get what is ready to be evicted right now.
737        while let Ok(Some(eviction)) =
738            tokio::time::timeout(Duration::from_nanos(5), store.next_eviction()).await
739        {
740            evicted.push(eviction.0);
741            store.evict(eviction);
742        }
743        evicted
744    }
745
746    macro_rules! assert_state {
747        ($store:ident, $project_key:ident, $state:pat) => {
748            assert!(matches!(
749                $store.shared().get_or_create($project_key).project_state(),
750                $state
751            ));
752        };
753    }
754
755    #[tokio::test(start_paused = true)]
756    async fn test_store_fetch() {
757        let project_key = ProjectKey::parse("aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa").unwrap();
758        let mut store = ProjectStore::default();
759        let config = Default::default();
760
761        let fetch = store.try_begin_fetch(project_key, &config).unwrap();
762        assert_eq!(fetch.project_key(), project_key);
763        assert_eq!(fetch.when(), None);
764        assert_eq!(fetch.revision().as_str(), None);
765        assert_state!(store, project_key, ProjectState::Pending);
766
767        // Fetch already in progress, nothing to do.
768        assert!(store.try_begin_fetch(project_key, &config).is_none());
769
770        // A pending fetch should trigger a new fetch immediately.
771        let fetch = fetch.complete(ProjectState::Pending.into());
772        let fetch = store.complete_fetch(fetch, &config).unwrap();
773        assert_eq!(fetch.project_key(), project_key);
774        // First backoff is still immediately.
775        assert_eq!(fetch.when(), None);
776        assert_eq!(fetch.revision().as_str(), None);
777        assert_state!(store, project_key, ProjectState::Pending);
778
779        // Pending again.
780        let fetch = fetch.complete(ProjectState::Pending.into());
781        let fetch = store.complete_fetch(fetch, &config).unwrap();
782        assert_eq!(fetch.project_key(), project_key);
783        // This time it needs to be in the future (backoff).
784        assert!(fetch.when() > Some(Instant::now()));
785        assert_eq!(fetch.revision().as_str(), None);
786        assert_state!(store, project_key, ProjectState::Pending);
787
788        // Now complete with disabled.
789        let fetch = fetch.complete(ProjectState::Disabled.into());
790        assert!(store.complete_fetch(fetch, &config).is_none());
791        assert_state!(store, project_key, ProjectState::Disabled);
792
793        // A new fetch is not yet necessary.
794        assert!(store.try_begin_fetch(project_key, &config).is_none());
795    }
796
797    #[tokio::test(start_paused = true)]
798    async fn test_store_fetch_pending_does_not_replace_state() {
799        let project_key = ProjectKey::parse("aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa").unwrap();
800        let mut store = ProjectStore::default();
801        let config = Config::from_json_value(serde_json::json!({
802            "cache": {
803                "project_expiry": 5,
804                "project_grace_period": 5,
805            }
806        }))
807        .unwrap();
808
809        let fetch = store.try_begin_fetch(project_key, &config).unwrap();
810        let fetch = fetch.complete(ProjectState::Disabled.into());
811        assert!(store.complete_fetch(fetch, &config).is_none());
812        assert_state!(store, project_key, ProjectState::Disabled);
813
814        tokio::time::advance(Duration::from_secs(6)).await;
815
816        let fetch = store.try_begin_fetch(project_key, &config).unwrap();
817        let fetch = fetch.complete(ProjectState::Pending.into());
818        // We're returned a new fetch, because the current one completed pending.
819        let fetch = store.complete_fetch(fetch, &config).unwrap();
820        // The old cached state is still available and not replaced.
821        assert_state!(store, project_key, ProjectState::Disabled);
822
823        let fetch = fetch.complete(ProjectState::new_allowed().into());
824        assert!(store.complete_fetch(fetch, &config).is_none());
825        assert_state!(store, project_key, ProjectState::Enabled(_));
826    }
827
828    #[tokio::test(start_paused = true)]
829    async fn test_store_evict_projects() {
830        let project_key1 = ProjectKey::parse("aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa").unwrap();
831        let project_key2 = ProjectKey::parse("bbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbb").unwrap();
832        let mut store = ProjectStore::default();
833        let config = Config::from_json_value(serde_json::json!({
834            "cache": {
835                "project_expiry": 5,
836                "project_grace_period": 0,
837            }
838        }))
839        .unwrap();
840
841        let fetch = store.try_begin_fetch(project_key1, &config).unwrap();
842        let fetch = fetch.complete(ProjectState::Disabled.into());
843        assert!(store.complete_fetch(fetch, &config).is_none());
844
845        assert_eq!(collect_evicted(&mut store).await, Vec::new());
846        assert_state!(store, project_key1, ProjectState::Disabled);
847
848        // 3 seconds is not enough to expire any project.
849        tokio::time::advance(Duration::from_secs(3)).await;
850
851        assert_eq!(collect_evicted(&mut store).await, Vec::new());
852        assert_state!(store, project_key1, ProjectState::Disabled);
853
854        let fetch = store.try_begin_fetch(project_key2, &config).unwrap();
855        let fetch = fetch.complete(ProjectState::Disabled.into());
856        assert!(store.complete_fetch(fetch, &config).is_none());
857
858        // A total of 6 seconds should expire the first project.
859        tokio::time::advance(Duration::from_secs(3)).await;
860
861        assert_eq!(collect_evicted(&mut store).await, vec![project_key1]);
862        assert_state!(store, project_key1, ProjectState::Pending);
863        assert_state!(store, project_key2, ProjectState::Disabled);
864    }
865
866    #[tokio::test(start_paused = true)]
867    async fn test_store_evict_projects_pending_not_expired() {
868        let project_key1 = ProjectKey::parse("aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa").unwrap();
869        let project_key2 = ProjectKey::parse("bbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbb").unwrap();
870        let mut store = ProjectStore::default();
871        let config = Config::from_json_value(serde_json::json!({
872            "cache": {
873                "project_expiry": 5,
874                "project_grace_period": 0,
875            }
876        }))
877        .unwrap();
878
879        let fetch = store.try_begin_fetch(project_key1, &config).unwrap();
880        // Create a new project in a pending state, but never fetch it, this should also never expire.
881        store.shared().get_or_create(project_key2);
882
883        tokio::time::advance(Duration::from_secs(6)).await;
884
885        // No evictions, project is pending.
886        assert_eq!(collect_evicted(&mut store).await, Vec::new());
887
888        // Complete the project.
889        let fetch = fetch.complete(ProjectState::Disabled.into());
890        assert!(store.complete_fetch(fetch, &config).is_none());
891
892        // Still should not be evicted, because we do have 5 seconds to expire since completion.
893        assert_eq!(collect_evicted(&mut store).await, Vec::new());
894        tokio::time::advance(Duration::from_secs(4)).await;
895        assert_eq!(collect_evicted(&mut store).await, Vec::new());
896        assert_state!(store, project_key1, ProjectState::Disabled);
897
898        // Just enough to expire the project.
899        tokio::time::advance(Duration::from_millis(1001)).await;
900        assert_eq!(collect_evicted(&mut store).await, vec![project_key1]);
901        assert_state!(store, project_key1, ProjectState::Pending);
902        assert_state!(store, project_key2, ProjectState::Pending);
903    }
904
905    #[tokio::test(start_paused = true)]
906    async fn test_store_evict_projects_stale() {
907        let project_key = ProjectKey::parse("aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa").unwrap();
908        let mut store = ProjectStore::default();
909        let config = Config::from_json_value(serde_json::json!({
910            "cache": {
911                "project_expiry": 5,
912                "project_grace_period": 5,
913            }
914        }))
915        .unwrap();
916
917        let fetch = store.try_begin_fetch(project_key, &config).unwrap();
918        let fetch = fetch.complete(ProjectState::Disabled.into());
919        assert!(store.complete_fetch(fetch, &config).is_none());
920
921        // This is in the grace period, but not yet expired.
922        tokio::time::advance(Duration::from_millis(9500)).await;
923
924        assert_eq!(collect_evicted(&mut store).await, Vec::new());
925        assert_state!(store, project_key, ProjectState::Disabled);
926
927        // Now it's expired.
928        tokio::time::advance(Duration::from_secs(1)).await;
929
930        assert_eq!(collect_evicted(&mut store).await, vec![project_key]);
931        assert_state!(store, project_key, ProjectState::Pending);
932    }
933
934    #[tokio::test(start_paused = true)]
935    async fn test_store_no_eviction_during_fetch() {
936        let project_key = ProjectKey::parse("aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa").unwrap();
937        let mut store = ProjectStore::default();
938        let config = Config::from_json_value(serde_json::json!({
939            "cache": {
940                "project_expiry": 5,
941                "project_grace_period": 5,
942            }
943        }))
944        .unwrap();
945
946        let fetch = store.try_begin_fetch(project_key, &config).unwrap();
947
948        // Project is expired, but there is an ongoing fetch.
949        tokio::time::advance(Duration::from_millis(10500)).await;
950        // No evictions, there is a fetch ongoing!
951        assert_eq!(collect_evicted(&mut store).await, Vec::new());
952
953        // Complete the project.
954        let fetch = fetch.complete(ProjectState::Disabled.into());
955        assert!(store.complete_fetch(fetch, &config).is_none());
956        // But start a new fetch asap (after grace period).
957        tokio::time::advance(Duration::from_millis(5001)).await;
958        let fetch = store.try_begin_fetch(project_key, &config).unwrap();
959
960        // Again, expire the project.
961        tokio::time::advance(Duration::from_millis(10500)).await;
962        // No evictions, there is a fetch ongoing!
963        assert_eq!(collect_evicted(&mut store).await, Vec::new());
964
965        // Complete the project.
966        let fetch = fetch.complete(ProjectState::Disabled.into());
967        assert!(store.complete_fetch(fetch, &config).is_none());
968
969        // Not quite yet expired.
970        tokio::time::advance(Duration::from_millis(9500)).await;
971        assert_eq!(collect_evicted(&mut store).await, Vec::new());
972        // Now it's expired.
973        tokio::time::advance(Duration::from_millis(501)).await;
974        assert_eq!(collect_evicted(&mut store).await, vec![project_key]);
975        assert_state!(store, project_key, ProjectState::Pending);
976    }
977}
